title: Former Kerala CM VS Achuthanandan's health condition remains critical
text: States » SouthPosted at: Jul 3 2025 9:52AM Former Kerala CM VS Achuthanandan’s health condition remains criticalThiruvananthapuram, July 3 (UNI) Former Kerala Chief Minister V.S. Achuthanandan, who was admitted to the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) of SUT Hospital, following a heart attack, continues to remain in a critical condition.In addition to the medical team at SUT Hospital, a special team of seven specialists from Thiruvananthapuram Medical College is also monitoring his health condition, hospital sources said.The medical board has decided to continue the ongoing treatment, including ventilator support, Continuous Renal Replacement Therapy (CRRT), and antibiotics, with provisions to make necessary adjustments as required.A meeting of the medical board was also held to evaluate the former chief minister's health status.He was admitted to the hospital on June 23 following a heart attack, shortly after returning home from his routine check-up on June 22.The medical bulletin states that efforts are ongoing to stabilize his heartbeat and respiration with the support of life-saving equipment.Earlier, Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan and several others visited the hospital to enquire about V.S. Achuthanandan’s health. Since they were unable to meet him directly, they spoke with doctors and family members to get an update on his condition before leaving.According to hospital authorities, a team of expert doctors is working to maintain his breathing, blood pressure, and kidney functions with the help of various life-support systems.His treatment is being closely monitored and managed by a team of specialists from multiple departments.VS Achuthanandan, also known as Fidel Castro of Kerala, was the Chief Minister of the State from 2006 to 2011. He served as the chairman of administrative reforms in Kerala with state cabinet rank from 2016 to 2021. He was thrice leader of the Opposition in the Kerala Assembly.He entered politics through trade union activities and joined the state Congress in 1938. In 1940 he became a member of the Communist Party of India (CPI). He is the only living Keralite among the 32 members who left the CPI National Council in 1964 to form the CPI(M).During his 40 years as a politician, he was imprisoned for five years and six months and was in hiding for four and half years. He was the secretary of the party's Kerala State Committee between 1980 and 1992. UNI DS PRSTags: #Former Kerala CM VS Achuthanandan’s health condition remains critical
